divs: Sighting DetailsA group of high altitude objects flying north-north east approximately threedegrees north of, and parallel to, the constellation of Cassiopia. These objectswere flying in a consistent triangular formation for the entire observationalperiod. There was no sound, nor contrails. The formation was tight. I observedthe objects through binoculars, as I was doing some late night star gazing. Theform or outline of the objects could not be ascertained, however appeared tohave the magnitude of about a 3rd magnitude star.
trends: There have been 33 other sightings in Santa Clarita
There were no other sightings in Santa Clarita on or around June 25th 2004
Summary: Group of orange lights 311am 3 degrees N of Cassio
